attributes.action: Limit second jobs for Members of Parliament
attributes.additional_details: Right now there is a very clear conflict of interest, namely that MPs are free to use their positions to receive funding far in excess of their salaries. If we want to ensure that public money is being well-spent, then we should stop our MPs from earning considerably more from "second" jobs than they do from actually being an MP.
attributes.background: Increase the tax rate on MPs to 100% for any income in addition to their salary as a parliamentarian over the median national income. We expect our elected representatives to work for the money they are paid by the public, not for external interests.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/630900

If you would like to pursue a separate petition about tax rates for additional income for MPs please email us at petitionscommittee@parliament.uk, and we can discuss your petition.
